description_txt: stated on October 5, 2014 in an interview on WLNE's "On the Record":
quote_txt: "I was speaking out on pension reform almost 17 years ago."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 20, 2014

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2014 in television attack ad:
quote_txt: "Jason Carter’s plan: increase spending by $12.5 billion."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "This (Ebola) is not as bad as SARS was in 2003."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2014 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Some doctors say Ebola can be transmitted through the air by "a sneeze or some cough."

description_txt: stated on September 23, 2014 in a speech.:
quote_txt: In 1968 "the average corporate CEO made 20 times the average worker’s pay. Today that multiple is about 350."

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2014 in a speech in Washington, D.C.:
quote_txt: "Prayer rugs have recently been found on the Texas side of the border in the brush."

name_txt: Local 799 of the International Assoc. of Fire Fighters
description_txt: stated on October 8, 2014 in in a mailer:
quote_txt: "Elorza wants to teach our public school children about the ‘non-existence of God.’"

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2014 in an interview on Rhode Island Public Radio:
quote_txt: "In the past three years, we have prosecuted or brought more cases on access to public records than in the previous 12 years combined."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 18, 2014

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a video ad:
quote_txt: "In 2013," Dan Patrick voted "against funding to test the backlog of rape kits, allowing rapists to walk free."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2014 in a debate:
quote_txt: Under Scott Walker’s policies, "the typical Wisconsin family has actually seen their real income drop by nearly $3,000 in the last four years."

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2014 in remarks during a campaign stop:
quote_txt: "More than 70,000" job openings are listed on a state jobs website.

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2014 in a newspaper editorial:
quote_txt: Almost every state has offered an insurance plan on its health exchange that does not cover abortion.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a broadcast of the "Glenn Beck Program":
quote_txt: "Every time somebody new gets the Ebola virus, it mutates."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2014 in a campaign forum:
quote_txt: "All four on Mount Rushmore, they were all independents at one critical point in their career."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a gubernatorial debate in Davie:
quote_txt: Says Charlie Crist "voted against minimum wage when he was in the Senate."

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2014 in a chain email:
quote_txt: "2014 Federal Tax Refunds To Be Delayed Until October 2015."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2014 in a debate:
quote_txt: Under my platform, "I will make no changes to the current (Medicare) system for current retirees and anyone approaching retirement."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2014 in a broadcast of PBS' "Newshour":
quote_txt: Republicans "made it easier to buy a gun" in states they won in 2010.

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2014 in a direct mail flier:
quote_txt: "Under the administration of Gov. Scott Walker, northern Wisconsin’s mining economy is moving forward and more people are getting good, high-paying jobs."

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2014 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Under Scott Walker's "tax plan, the average Wisconsin taxpayer got just $11 a month. But corporations got $610 million in tax cuts. Millionaires got at least $1,400 per year."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a gubernatorial debate in Davie:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush -- not Charlie Crist -- signed legislation that let Duke Energy collect money for nuclear projects.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a debate at Broward College:
quote_txt: "3,000 teachers lost their jobs when (Crist) was governor."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2014 in a debate at Broward College:
quote_txt: If Florida expanded Medicaid, "some studies indicate it would create about 120,000 jobs."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2014 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Weeks after accepting a quarter-million-dollar campaign contribution" from a hospital board chairman, Greg Abbott went to court against victims of a drug-taking neurosurgeon.

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2014 in a debate:
quote_txt: "Iowa has the fourth fastest-growing personal income in the United States, while nationally, the real wage has decreased over the past eight years that Congressman (Bruce) Braley has been there by 2.7 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 5, 2014 in a campaign news release:
quote_txt: "As district attorney, Susan Happ took $180,000" in a "shady" land deal "from a man charged with multiple felony counts of sexual assault before she offered him a deferred prosecution."

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2014 in a U.S. Senate debate:
quote_txt: Four million women have fallen into poverty in the last six years.

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2014 in an interview for "Inside Texas Politics" on WFAA-TV, Channel 8, in Dallas:
quote_txt: My office sends federal "money back every year."

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2014 in an email newsletter:
quote_txt: The Greenlight Pinellas 1-cent sales tax "is permanent, we never get to vote on this again."

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2014 in a debate:
quote_txt: Raising the minimum wage to $10.10 an hour, "would help lift over a million Americans out of poverty."
